DOCNAME: CASE OF FLORIN MACOVEI v. ROMANIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ ORG ” ) suspended the applicant from work for gross misconduct , that is , suspicion of fraud , malfeasance in public office and document destruction . A criminal complaint was further filed by ORG with the prosecution authorities on DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant complained about the protraction of the investigation . His complaint was admitted on DATE by ORG as no procedural act had been carried out until DATE . The prosecuting authorities were instructed to deal with the complaint within reasonable delays .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG with ORG no . CARDINAL ( “ the Prosecutor ” ) decided to initiate the criminal prosecution against the applicant .

CARDINAL . By a subsequent decision of DATE the Prosecutor rejected the initiation of prosecution in respect of the applicant as his conduct did not meet the statutory essential elements of the prosecuted offences . ORG contested this decision before ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the contestation was allowed and the criminal prosecution was resumed .

CARDINAL . Subsequent to the examination of evidence ( hearing of CARDINAL witness testimonies and examination of few documents , without the commission of any expert study ) , the Prosecutor decided on DATE to discontinue the investigation in respect of the applicant . The decision was challenged by ORG before ORG with ORG and ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the contestation was allowed and the impugned decision was quashed . The case was reopened for further investigation before the prosecuting authorities .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor decided to discontinue the investigation against the applicant in respect of the charges of fraud and malfeasance in public office . At the same time , an administrative fine was imposed for charges of document destruction .
CARDINAL . The decision was upheld before ORG and became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . Subsequent to the decisions to discontinue the criminal prosecution against him , the applicant requested to resume his work at ORG . Following the latter ’s refusal , the applicant brought CARDINAL sets of labour litigations against his employer on DATE and on an unspecified date in DATE respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the first action . It ruled that the applicant could not resume work since the decision to discontinue the criminal investigation had not been final at that time . Later on the applicant was reinstated to a different position at ORG . Shortly afterwards , the employment contract was voluntarily terminated .
CARDINAL . The second action was allowed by way of a final decision . On DATE ORG of GPE awarded the applicant the retroactive payment of wages he had been entitled to .
